results.content:
I loved this course from start to finish! I've done a few other CSS courses and this one is the best on the web!  I learned so much in terms of writing clean code, accessibility, animations, CSS grid, to name a few! 
Ed is a super awesome tutor,  creative, great personality, great at explaining things. I'm going straight into his Javascript course!

results.content:
I found this course very enjoyable and didactic.
The project oriented aproach makes it easier to focus and more interesting.  The instructor explains things nicely and manages to keep it engaging. I would have like more sass, but as an introduction it was perfect.
I followed the instructor on his youtube channel and I am very happy I bought this course, and his other course on JavaScript (which I will start soon). And if he ever does another course on web design and figma I would totally buy that too. 
I am very thankful to the instructor for deciding to create this course. It has helped me a lot and all in all  it has been a very rewarding experience. Totally reccomended!
results.content_html:
I found this course very enjoyable and didactic.
The project oriented aproach makes it easier to focus and more interesting. The instructor explains things nicely and manages to keep it engaging. I would have like more sass, but as an introduction it was perfect.
I followed the instructor on his youtube channel and I am very happy I bought this course, and his other course on JavaScript (which I will start soon). And if he ever does another course on web design and figma I would totally buy that too.
I am very thankful to the instructor for deciding to create this course. It has helped me a lot and all in all it has been a very rewarding experience. Totally reccomended!

results.content: Great material to both learn CSS from scratch or polish up your older CSS skills (my case). I loved the fact the instructor kept repeating key core concepts, such as flex boxes, which helps a lot to sink in.
results.content_html: Great material to both learn CSS from scratch or polish up your older CSS skills (my case). I loved the fact the instructor kept repeating key core concepts, such as flex boxes, which helps a lot to sink in.

results.content:
This is absolutely brilliant!

I've been trying to learn a lot of code during the past years, but somehow, I always found myself stuck somewhere and got discouraged.

Then I discovered Dev Ed on Youtube and it litterally changed my vision of how to learn stuff.

What is great is that you can start following these tutorials even if you don't get exactly what is going on and, BOOM, before you know it, it works!

It's fun to watch, perfectly explained, arrrrrgh, it's so good!

You are by far the best instructor I've been following and now I'm super excited because I can finally begin for real all the projects I had in my head for years.

Even made a mini educational website for my kid's school in a few hours, that's pretty cool.

This course is exactlty what I was expecting from you.
It's project-oriented (which is the best to learn, well for me at least), all the concepts are cristal clear, the price is ridiculously low for the quality.

Can't wait to enroll to the JavaScript course, with that I'll have everything I need to develop my ideas.

And for you guys who hesitate, well DON'T!
No hesitation here. This is it. This is crazy good.

Start before you're ready, try stuff, experiment, fail, try again, and, most importantly, give this guy some money so he can continue doing this amazing work.

Thank you so much my gorgeous friend on the Internet, keep it up!

(Sorry for my English, Im French. It's cool but not that much when it comes to speak English)

response.content: Thank you! You just made my day! All the best and happy coding!
response.content_html: Thank you! You just made my day! All the best and happy coding!

results.content: This is a great course for beginners! It moves very quickly, but it's easy to pause and rewind to review new concepts. Through the repetition of 3 website builds things start to look familiar, with a few new ideas with each one. Not a lot of in-depth descriptions of why things go where, but this definitely gave me the tools to play around and learn by doing.
results.content_html: This is a great course for beginners! It moves very quickly, but it's easy to pause and rewind to review new concepts. Through the repetition of 3 website builds things start to look familiar, with a few new ideas with each one. Not a lot of in-depth descriptions of why things go where, but this definitely gave me the tools to play around and learn by doing.

results.content:
Amazing course! You really learn how to build beautiful websites and you got all information you need because the explanations cover everything, and Ed gives some awesome and useful tips. Congratulations Ed to making such an amazing course, and thank you!

results.content: Going in I did not know much about HTML and CSS, so this was a good way to get up and running. The instructor has a good eye for design, which means that the first websites you are creating feel like real world websites. I wish there were a few more challenges. There are competitor websites which I feel aren't as good as Udemy, but what they do have is lots of challenges. Personally I find that these help me focus more rather than just following someone else code. Just a personal preference.

results.content:
Phenomenal course. I thought I knew all there was to HTML and CSS but this taught me new things. The animations were my favourite part! The websites we built were the kind i've been looking to learn to create in the other web development courses i've taken. 

I hope you create a design course next because you'd do a great job teaching us everything we need to know to create awesome modern websites. Also it would be really great if you could show us how as web designers we could use blender to incorporate some unique design aspects to our websites.

results.content:
Amazing course. It's the right balance between theory and practice: just enough theory to understand what he's talking about but enough practice to not be bored and waiting for it to pass.
Ed is also a wonderful teacher (my favorite so far, I'm even following him on Youtube, check him out if you're interested because he posts a lot of stuff to deepen your HTML/CSS/Javascript knowledge!). He's engaging and funny, and really makes you want to learn HTML/CSS. His projects are also fun to make, and very comprehensive (I've learned a lot of things I didn't know about, and I've followed other HTML/CSS courses before).
The only weakness of this course is that, in my opinion, you need to have at least the basics of HTML/CSS. He jumps right in from the beginning, and complete beginners can feel a little lost at first. 
But still, that's not enough to make me give under five stars!
results.content_html:

results.content:
Dev Ed is a great instructor, both for beginners and also those who possess intermediate knowledge. His style is very lively and humorous, which turns programming into a calming, enjoyable hobby. 

You should definitely check out his YouTube channel, where you can learn a lot from him for free.

I hope to see his other courses on Udemy as well!

results.content: A fantastic introduction to HTML5 and CSS3.
results.content_html: A fantastic introduction to HTML5 and CSS3.

results.content: First of all a big thanks to the instructor "Simo Edwin" for making this course understandable to everyone. He covers from the solid foundation of HTML5 & CSS3 which takes up to 4hrs of content and ends with 3 cool projects. The coolest part of this course is Flexbox, CSS GRID, SASS & Netlify (deployment). I would recommend this course for complete beginners. 100% satisfied with the course and I'm hopefully looking forward to take his next course.
results.content_html: First of all a big thanks to the instructor "Simo Edwin" for making this course understandable to everyone. He covers from the solid foundation of HTML5 & CSS3 which takes up to 4hrs of content and ends with 3 cool projects. The coolest part of this course is Flexbox, CSS GRID, SASS & Netlify (deployment). I would recommend this course for complete beginners. 100% satisfied with the course and I'm hopefully looking forward to take his next course.

Hay Ed, "Why you do this..." this course is exactly what i need. I`m 31 years and this will be my last course because I think there is no need more than this course to start a career(off-course and your JS course ;)  )After all videos after all projects...now should go on with JS. Your course is perfect on time with latest technologies and I think this is enough for basic HTML and CSS knowledge. Of course everyone has to start practicing because this is the way that has to be done. 
Thank you again Ed.

results.content: I have a little knowledge of these two languages but this course has enabled me to enhance my own current skillset. The teaching methods are really good, everything is clearly explained and if something didn't look right, it was more than likely down to what I was doing with the syntax (not putting a "," for examply in the right place). The pace of the course I felt was good and I am looking to design some things off the back of this. Really good course, thank you Ed!

results.content: Great course, but its definitely not for complete beginners. but i learned so much. I would advise anyone who is serious about learning web design to take this course. however, I would take a beginner course first, i took 3 beginner courses prior to taking this course and there were many things that were brand new to me. also some things you will learn, he wont go into deep detail about them, but he goes into enough detail that you get a good idea of whats going on and can get a complete grasp on it with a quick google search. Great course, highly recommended.
